articles.title: Elon Musk Just Said Tesla Has a $10 Trillion Opportunity, and It Has Nothing to Do With the Car Business
articles.content: Elon Musk claims Tesla's humanoid robot Optimus has the potential to be a $10 trillion business, separate from its electric vehicle operations. While the exact revenue potential is uncertain, Optimus could complement Tesla's labor force and unlock significant value in the long run.

articles.title: Best Stock to Buy Right Now: SiriusXM vs. Apple
articles.content: The article compares Apple and SiriusXM, noting that while SiriusXM dominates satellite radio, its subscriber growth has stagnated, and it faces intense competition in the music subscription space. In contrast, Apple has a more diversified business and continues to introduce new products and services, making it a more attractive investment option.

articles.title: Why Trying to Copy Warren Buffett's Latest Moves May Not Be a Great Strategy for Investors
articles.content: Investors should not blindly copy Warren Buffett's stock picks, as his investment strategy and goals may not align with their own. Buffett's portfolio has underperformed the broader market in recent years, and his aversion to riskier tech stocks may cause investors to miss out on growth opportunities.

articles.title: If You Bought 1 Share of Apple at Its IPO, Here's How Many Shares You Would Own Now
articles.content: If you had bought 1 share of Apple at its IPO, you would now own 224 shares due to multiple stock splits. Apple's stock price has seen tremendous appreciation, trading at $236 as of January 31st. However, the company's valuation indicates the market expects fast growth, and investors will likely want to see better than the 4% revenue growth posted in its fiscal 2025 first quarter.
